title: Anatomy Education and USMLE Step 1 Preparation Strategies Using Proximal Peer Tutoring

context.prior_knowledge: Basic anatomy and medical terminology comprehension
context.additional_context: Course designed for practicing professionals to strengthen expertise through anatomy education and peer-teaching experiences, applicable to standardized assessment preparation

learning_goals: Students can explain the principles of proximal peer teaching (e.g., retrieval practice, metacognitive utilization) and apply them to actual educational scenarios.
Students can deeply understand and reconstruct core concepts while teaching anatomical educational materials to peers.
Students enhance their ability to apply knowledge to standardized assessment items through case analyses similar to USMLE Step 1.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
